original_title: Sri Lanka cabinet approves trade talks with Indonesia
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers has approved discussions with Indonesia with a view to signing a preferential trade agreement, Minister Bandula Gunawardana said.
“Indonesia is one of the largest economies in South East Asia,” Gunawardana said. “There are discussion to give preferences to selected goods.
“The preferential agreement will help increase export access and also import competitively.”
President Ranil Wickremesinghe had proposed agreements with several countries to boost export import trade, he said.

Sri Lanka is expediting talks with several agreements, including Thailand, China and some sections of an agreement with Singapore, under the guidance of President Ranil Wickremesinghe, he said. (Colombo/July12/2023)
